intro: Oxypetalum guaraniticum, commonly known as the Guaraní rose, is a flowering plant native to the cerrado biome of Brazil. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the seasonal climate of its native habitat. Oxypetalum guaraniticum plays an important ecological role in its ecosystem and is also valued for its ornamental qualities.
